item.title: Minimum Viable Writing
item.description: I was reading “Writing Tools” by Roy Peter Clark, to gain some insights that will help me write better. Tool 24 about working from a plan stood out to me. Minimum Viable Writing In the book, Roy cited an interesting example. About readings being able to get the story and the gist of the writing, the essential parts of the writing, from the headings and subheadings alone. In other words, from headings and subheadings, we can quickly determine if the idea presented would be valuable, or not.
